intro: Sebaea welwitschii, commonly known as the Welwitsch sebaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in rocky or arid environments. Its botanical features include hairy stems and a branching structure that allows it to thrive in harsh conditions. Sebaea welwitschii is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
